cause: Committed to ending mass incarceration and excessive punishment in the United States
To ensure student success by promoting educational excellence and preparing the next generation of workforce talent through leadership development
info: Provides scholarships, capacity building and programmatic support, and advocacy for students and public Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs).

cause: Healthier lives through effective prevention and treatment of infectious diseases
info: Founded in 1973, the National Foundation for Infectious Diseases (NFID) is dedicated to educating the public and healthcare professionals about the burden, causes, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of infectious diseases across the lifespan. Core values include collaboration, diversity and inclusion, evidence-based, integrity, and transparency.
